title: Check for Discriminant
text: For any given parabolar $${ax}^2+bx+c$$, the discriminant is $$b^2-4ac$$. If the discriminant is greater than $$0$$, there are two x-intercepts for the parabola. If the discriminant equals zero, there is only one x-intercept for the parabola. If the discriminant is less than zero, there is no x-intercept for the parabola.

title: Check for Discriminant
text: In this given parabola, $$a=-1$$, $$b=8$$, and $$c=-19$$. $$b^2-4ac=8^2-4\left(-1\right) \left(-19\right)=-12$$ which is less than zero, so there is no x-intercept for this parabola.
